entry.title: The London Borough of Barnet (Trunk Roads) Red Route (Priority Traffic Lanes) Experimental Traffic Order 1999 Revocation Order 1999
entry.summary: This version of the The London Borough of Barnet (Trunk Roads) Red Route (Priority Traffic Lanes) Experimental Traffic Order 1999 Revocation Order 1999 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Merger Reference (Universal Foods Corporation and Pointing Holdings Limited) (Interim Provision) (Revocation) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order revokes the Merger Reference (Universal Foods Corporation and Pointing Holdings Limited) (Interim Provision) Order 1999. The earlier Order was made to prevent action which might prejudice the investigation by the Competition Commission of the merger between Universal Foods Corporation and Pointing Holdings Limited. The report of the Competition Commission on their investigation has been published by The Stationery Office (Cm 4544).

entry.title: The Police (Secretary of State’s Objectives) (No. 3) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order sets out the Secretary of State’s objective for the policing of the areas of all police authorities established under section 3 of the Police Act 1996. Section 6(2)(a) of the 1996 Act requires police authorities to have regard to these objectives in the discharge of their functions. Local policing objectives determined under section 7 of the 1996 Act must be consistent with these objectives. Section 8 of the 1996 Act requires police authorities to issue local policing plans which must give particulars of these objectives.

entry.title: The A40 Trunk Road (Ealing and Hammersmith & Fulham) Red Route Experimental Traffic Order 1999 Experimental Variation Order 1999
entry.summary: This version of the The A40 Trunk Road (Ealing and Hammersmith & Fulham) Red Route Experimental Traffic Order 1999 Experimental Variation Order 1999 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Income Support (General) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 (“the Income Support Regulations”).

entry.title: The Animal Feedingstuffs from Belgium (Control) (England and Wales) (No. 4) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply to England and Wales, revoke, and re-enact with certain changes, the Animal Feedingstuffs from Belgium (Control) (England and Wales) (No. 3) Regulations 1999 (S.I. 1999/2799 “the revoked Regulations”) and implement in England and Wales, in relation to products for animal feeding, Commission Decision 1999/788/EC on protective measures with regard to contamination by dioxins of certain products of porcine and poultry origin intended for human or animal consumption (OJ No. L310, 4.12.1999, p. 62).

entry.title: The Income Support (General) and Jobseeker’s Allowance (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 and the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996.

entry.title: The A23 Trunk Road (Croydon) Red Route Traffic Order 1999 Experimental Variation Order 1999
entry.summary: This version of the The A23 Trunk Road (Croydon) Red Route Traffic Order 1999 Experimental Variation Order 1999 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Food (Animal Products from Belgium) (Emergency Control) (England and Wales) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order, which applies to England and Wales, revokes, and re-enacts with certain changes, the Food (Animals and Animal Products from Belgium) (Emergency Control) (England and Wales) (No. 3) Order 1999 (S.I. 1999/2798 “the revoked Order”) and implements in England and Wales, in relation to food, Commission Decision 1999/788/EC on protective measures with regard to contamination by dioxins of certain products of porcine and poultry origin intended for human or animal consumption (OJ No. L310, 4.12.1999, p.62).

entry.title: The Social Fund (Maternity and Funeral Expenses) (General) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Fund (Maternity and Funeral Expenses) (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987.

entry.title: The Plant Protection Products (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply in Great Britain, further amend the Plant Protection Products Regulations 1995 (S.I. 1995/887) as amended (“the principal Regulations”) which implement in Great Britain Council Directive 91/414/EEC concerning the placing of plant protection products on the market (OJ No. L230, 19.8.91, p. 1 as read with OJ No. L170, 25.6.92, p. 40) (“the Directive”) as amended.

entry.title: The Road Transport (Passenger Vehicles Cabotage) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations implement in Great Britain Council Regulation (EC) No. 12/98 of 11 December 1997 (“the EC Regulation”) which lays down the conditions under which road passenger transport carriers of member States may operate cabotage transport operations.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (County of Kent) (City of Canterbury) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order designates the District of the City of Canterbury, excluding that section of the A2 and its on and off slip roads situated within the District, that section of the A299 and its on and off slip roads situated within the District and that section of the Broomfield Link Road situated within the District, as both a permitted parking area and a special parking area in accordance with Schedule 3 to the Road Traffic Act 1991. It also applies with modifications various provisions of Part II of that Act to the designated area and modifies the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 in relation to the designated area.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (County of Kent) (Borough of Tunbridge Wells) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order designates the Borough of Tunbridge Wells, excepting that section of the A21 trunk road and its slip roads situated within the Borough, as both a permitted parking area and a special parking area in accordance with Schedule 3 to the Road Traffic Act 1991. It also applies with modifications various provisions of Part II of that Act to the designated area and modifies the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 in relation to the designated area.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (County of Kent) (Borough of Swale) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order designates the Borough of Swale, excluding that part of the M2 Motorway in the Borough, a section of the A2 trunk road and its slip roads in the Borough, a section of the A249 trunk road and its slip roads in the Borough and the A299 Clearway and its slip roads for its whole length in the Borough, as both a permitted parking area and a special parking area in accordance with Schedule 3 to the Road Traffic Act 1991. It also applies with modifications various provisions of Part II of that Act to the designated area and modifies the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 in relation to the designated area.

entry.title: The Shetland Islands Regulated Fishery (Scotland) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order confers on the Shetland Shellfish Management Organisation (“the Organisation”) the right of regulating a fishery for oysters, mussels, cockles, clams, lobsters, scallops, queens, crabs, whelks and razorshells (“the prescribed species”) on the bed of the sea adjacent to the Shetland Islands for a period of 10 years (article 2).

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (County of Kent) (District of Thanet) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order designates the District of Thanet, excluding the A299 road for the whole of its length in the District and the A253 road for part of its length in the District, as both a permitted parking area and a special parking area in accordance with Schedule 3 to the Road Traffic Act 1991. It also applies with modifications various provisions of Part II of that Act to the designated area and modifies the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 in relation to the designated area.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (County of Kent) (District of Sevenoaks) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order designates the District of Sevenoaks, excluding the M20 Motorway, the M25 Motorway, the M26 Motorway and the A21 trunk road, together with their on and off slip roads, for the whole of their lengths in the District and a section of the A20 trunk road, together with its on and off slip roads, as both a permitted parking area and a special parking area in accordance with Schedule 3 to the Road Traffic Act 1991. It also applies with modifications various provisions of Part II of that Act to the designated area and modifies the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 in relation to the designated area.

entry.title: Employment Rights (Increase of Limits) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order increases, from 1st February 2000, the limits applying to certain awards of employment tribunals, and other amounts payable under employment legislation, as specified in the Schedule to the Order.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Scotland) (Injury Benefits) Amendment (No.2) Regulations 1999
